The web site makes it possible for the neighbors in this community to interact, be creative and share valuable and timely information using a unique combination of technology and the internet. Use this web site to become enlightened about your neighborhood. This web site can be added to your internet list of favorites or make it your homepage. Please take a tour and see the information and services that are now at your fingertips. Visit often and participate when you can. Please register and log in to gain access to the entire site and make comments and submit ideas. Some of the items include a community calendar, a quarterly Newsletter, a forum for comments and discussions about items of interest, a photo gallery to submit and share photos, a news column, and classified ad section. Listed under the “info” section, find the President’s message, List of Board of Directors and how to contact them, Meeting Agendas, Board Minutes, legal information including Rules and Regulations, Covenants and Restrictions, By-Laws, Committees and their members and a list of important telephone numbers etc.. Take a tour of the site and see what is here for you to view. Submit information to the webworm to share with everyone. Brought to you by your Halifax Plantation Phase 1 Homeowner’s Association. Contact Us if you have any questions. This website was created to allow Halifax Plantation residents to share information of all types relating to the Association’s activities and members, including offering services or items for sale. This is a “family” group. Standards of conduct are simple: All postings should be courteous, polite, in good taste and relevant to the Association or its members and residents. Postings that fail to meet these criteria will be removed as will the individual poster. Let this site be your virtual gateway to the local community and the Internet. We encourage you to use this web site for the valuable and timely information it offers about your neighborhood – add us to your list of favorites or make it your homepage! Do you want to get rid of some personal items you no longer need? List your items in the free Resident Classified Ads. Please take a tour and see the wonderful information and services that are now at your fingertips. Come back often. Brought to you by the Halifax Plantation Phases 2 and 3 Home Owners Association. Contact us if you have any website questions. Please register with this site to qualify for more features and access to many powerful tools. Follow the registration instructions above. If you have already registered, simply login. If you have any website problem, contact us . A neighborhood Watch is designed to provide extra eyes and ears for law enforcement. The program requires volunteer block captains and co-captains to work with a local Prevention Deputy to educate members in the principles of deterrence, delay and detection and to communicate events to the entire group. Members are instructed how to report suspicious activity to the Sheriff’s Office as soon as it’s observed. The key to a safe community is to share information and report suspicious activities. Neighborhood watch groups are a great way for citizens to work together to prevent crime, maintain a safe community and build relationships with neighbors. A number of residents have already volunteered to become block captains, but we could use more in both our older established sections and newer sections recently developed. If you would be interested in becoming a block captain or co-captain as part of our Neighborhood Watch, please email your name, address, email and phone number to HPNW23@yahoo.com . You will be contacted about an organizational meeting and have any questions answered. “Halifax Plantation Phase 2 & 3 … Great Places to Live!” © 2025 Halifax Plantation Phase 2 & 3 HOA

Beyond golf, the clubhouse has two different dining experiences in the Halifax Plantation Tavern & Pub.  The Tavern offers a sit-down, quiet atmosphere for dinner and the Pub offers an array of tv’s and space for your group to hangout after the round to reminisce and catch the game. See a Menu Here Being in Ormond Beach and adjacent to the three state parks (Tomoka, Bulow, and Bulow Plantation) and a preserve, the wildlife on the golf course and in the surrounding area are an added part of the experience.  Drive to the coast and drive the A1A to experience Palm Coast other than golf or jump on I-95 just a few miles west of the club. Tee Times Book your next tee time with fast and simple online reservations BOOK NOW Membership Experience the elegance of membership at Halifax Plantation MEMBERSHIPS E-CLUB Keep up to date with what’s happening at Halifax Plantation SIGN UP EXPERIENCE HALIFAX PLANTATION Nestled within a magnificent canopy of century-old Oaks and tall pines on high rolling terrain, the Halifax Plantation golf course is one of the most picturesque and enjoyable courses you will play along the East Coast of Central Florida. Our, Bill Amick, designed golf course attracts golfers of a variety of ages and skill levels which have been the trademark of his over 75 golf course designs worldwide. COURSE DETAILS MEMBERSHIP AT HALIFAX PLANTATION Halifax Plantation Golf Club is an amazing place to become a member! Not only is the course in pristine condition, but the staff will make you feel at home. As a member, you will have access to our beautiful championship golf course and the many amenities offered. Join us today for an unforgettable golfing experience! MEMBERSHIPS so much more than golf The social centerpiece of club life within Halifax Plantation can be found within our southern styled clubhouse. More traditional club dining is available in the Tavern restaurant, while The Pub offers a more casual social atmosphere with a variety of sports programming and music entertainment. We are the place for the best dining, meeting, holiday, wedding and special event opportunities. TAVERN & PUB “ We just had a great time at Halifax Plantation. We had a group of 24 and every single person that works there is the best. The food is phenomenal, the course has a great layout and is very challenging. They wanted to accommodate us in everyway possible. We will be back. Halifax Plantation Golf Club - Casago Palm Coast Casago Palm Coast Vacation Rentals Property Management Events Restaurants Franchise Casago Palm Coast Things To Do Halifax Plantation Golf Club Back to Things To Do About Reviews Tickets Hours & Location Contact Halifax Plantation Golf Club Written by www.casago.com’s Local Expert About The Halifax Plantation Golf Club is so much more than a lush golf course. This ancient oak-lined community is nestled in Bulow Creek and Tomoka State Park. Located in Ormond Beach, this plantation has residents. Just minutes away from the Atlantic Ocean, there are plenty of activities to enjoy. The grounds of this plantation include several amenities. To name a few, there is a tavern and pub restaurant, grand ballroom, junior Olympic-size pool, and fitness center. There is no limit to the activities for you and your family here! Golf Halifax Plantation Golf Club is an 18-hole, 72-par, picturesque course. Bill Amick, a renowned golf architect, designed this course. Both beginner and expert golfers will find a challenge here. To book a Tee Time, click the ticket link provided through GolfNow. Tee Times vary in cost. However, they typically range from $35 to $45. The Pub The Pub boasts an expansive menu! Choose from a variety of sandwiches, sliders, appetizers, pasta, and more. Additionally, they offer a dessert menu. To place a pick-up order, call the phone number using the extension listed in the contact information. Their full menu is listed on the website under "Dining and Social." The Tavern The Tavern's menu is the same as the Pub's. However, this restaurant is a lot busier due to its atmosphere. Therefore, reservations at this restaurant are highly recommended. Call ahead using the contact information and extension provided. Weddings & Events Golf courses are an extremely popular wedding venue. This is because they are often lush, nature scenes that provide a gorgeous backdrop for photos. In addition, there are often photogenic walking trails and lakes. The Halifax is no exception. This beautiful course frequently hosts significant events and weddings. The conference room can accommodate up to 20 people, and the Club Room fits up to 40. However, the Grand Ballroom can comfortably fit up to 250 guests! With its premiere 18-hole course and outstanding amenities, Halifax Plantation Golf Club will enhance any Palm Coast getaway. Local Tips Book Tee Times online via GolfNow - link in ticket section. Facilities may experience downtime for required maintenance. The Pub has Happy Hour every day from 4PM-6PM Reservations are recommended at The Tavern. Call ahead for availability. DHBC’s Board oversees a $2 million budget and the CEO, and is comprised of (max) 15 members of the Downtown Halifax business community , as well as one Municipal representative. 2025-2026 Board of Directors Faten Alshazly CEO, HEALTHEME COO, WEUSTHEM Dana Beeler EVENTS & DEVELOPMENT MANAGER, MUSIC NOVA SCOTIA Marilisa Benigno, Board Chair PRESIDENT, BENIGNO GROUP OF COMPANIES Darryl Bergman Glenn Bowie GENERAL MANAGER, THE WESTIN NOVA SCOTIAN Melissa Carey, Member at Large VICE PRESIDENT SALES & MARKETING, RCR HOSPITALITY GROUP Kristan Hines, Member at Large SENIOR VICE-PRESIDENT, CORPORATE & PUBLIC AFFAIRS, NATIONAL PUBLIC RELATIONS Jake Whalen SENIOR ADVISOR, ECONOMIC POLICY & DEVELOPMENT, HALIFAX REGIONAL MUNICIPALITY Raeesa Lalani ARTISTIC DIRECTOR, PRISMATIC ARTS FESTIVAL Joyce Liu FOUNDER & CEO, LUMI STUDIOS Joe McGuinness, Vice-Chair OWNER , PLATINUM GROUP Blaise Morrison, Secretary/Treasurer DEVELOPMENT & PLANNING, THE ARMOUR GROUP LTD. Help shape the future of Downtown Halifax Join our Board! With visitation numbers (to Downtown Halifax) finally back to pre-pandemic levels , and the continuous work being done around Downtown Halifax Vision 2030 , there's opportunity around every corner and the future is bright. Interested candidates for the 2026-2027 year can fill out the questionnaire (coming soon) by April 25, 2026 . Names will be assessed by the DHBC Board, and the Board Nominations Committee in the Spring 2026. If selected, you are encouraged to attend DHBC’s Annual General Meeting, typically held near the end of June every year, to be voted in. ( Although spots are limited, know that we keep a list of interested people for future years.) Time commitment : A two-year commitment, which can be extended for an additional two years. Regular board meetings are typically held five times/year on Wednesdays, usually around lunch, and can be hybrid, with some members logging in virtually from time-to-time. Board Members are required to sit on a committee (Advocacy, Executive, Finance, HR & Governance, IDEA, Marketing, Placemaking). The overall time commitment, barring unforeseen circumstances, is 25-35 hours per year. To assure a strong mix of skill sets and diversity, the more we know about you, the better. Once the questionnaire is completed, you will be contacted on next steps. Questionnaire coming soon! Be the first to know Stay up to date on all things happening downtown.
